newsitem.title: TUNISIA: Tunisian t-bill rates fall in liquid market.
newsitem.headline: Tunisian t-bill rates fall in liquid market.

text.p: The Tunisian Treasury on Tuesday sold 20 million dinars ($20 million) of 13-week and 26-week bills at its weekly auction dated February 4 at rates, with rates falling for the hird consecutive week in a highly liquid market.
It also repaid maturing paper totalling 19.7 million dinars.
The issue was at the following rates (amounts in million dnr)
Lower rates reflect a drop in the day-to-day interbank rate last month to 6.8125 percent from a 7.8125 percent official monetary market rate (TMM) in a highly liquid market.
High liquidity is reflected in the rise of the amount banks were offering for the third consecutive week for treasury paper.
Banks this week bid for 452 million dinars of 13-, 26-, 52-week and two-year paper at between 7.2500 and 7.6250 percent. ($=1.04 dinar)
